intro: Faramea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Faramea micrantha is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and understoreys.
